newsitem.title: USA: Quarterdeck hit by shareholder suit - plaintiffs.
newsitem.headline: Quarterdeck hit by shareholder suit - plaintiffs.

text.p: Lawyers for a group of investors in Quarterdeck Corp said Tuesday they filed a securities lawsuit alleging the company had made misleading statements about its financial results and certain products.

The suit was filed in the California Superior Court for Los Angeles County by plaintiffs Paul E. Nickerson, Jr., Albert Zucker and Mary Jane Crescente on behalf of purchasers of Quarterdeck stock during the period January 26, 1996 to June 13, 1996.
They are represented by law firms including Milberg Weiss Bershad Hynes & Lerach LLP and Kaplan, Kilsheimer & Fox LLP.

Further, they assert that Quarterdeck's financial statements for its first and second quarters of fiscal 1996 were materially false and misleading in violation of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, and that these statements artificially inflated the price of Quarterdeck stock.

The suit alleges that these actions allowed Quarterdeck to sell tens of thousands of shares of its stock and complete two acquisitions in the period before Quarterdeck reported it expected "sharply lower sales" and a "substantial operating loss" for the third fiscal quarter ended June 30, 1996.
The Santa Monica, Calif. based company was not immediately available to comment on the lawsuit.
